p: Taraxacum officinale (dandelion) is a perennial herb with leaves in rosettes at the soil level, showy yellow heads, and anemochorous seeds ( Figure 1). T. officinale is originated in central Europe and is considered one of the most aggressive invasive plants around the world [ 24]. T. officinale blooms year-round and is found growing in disturbed and undisturbed sites across a wide altitudinal and latitudinal gradient [ 25].
